analysis_n module¶

analysis_n.oneNumBar(df, colName)[source]¶

This function creates a bar plot for the column colName.

Parameters:
  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The pandas dataframe that contains data columns to be analysed.
  • colName (list) – The list of column names to be analysed. In this case, the list has one element.
Returns:

A dict with bar plot plotly graph and its label.
Return type:

dict
analysis_n.oneNumBox(df, colName)[source]¶

This function creates a box plot for the column distribution of colName.

Parameters:
  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The pandas dataframe that contains data columns to be analysed.
  • colName (list) – The list of column names to be analysed. In this case, the list has one element.
Returns:

A dict with box plot plotly graph and its label.
Return type:

dict
analysis_n.oneNumDist(df, colName)[source]¶

This function creates a distribution plot for the column colName.

Parameters:
  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The pandas dataframe that contains data columns to be analysed.
  • colName (list) – The list of column names to be analysed. In this case, the list has one element.
Returns:

A dict with distribution plot plotly graph and its label.
Return type:

dict
